snippet: The lawyer, Howard Dorfman, told a Senate panel that he told Martin Shkreli that the move would negatively affect Turing’s business and reputation.
abstract: Howard Dorfman, former general counsel of Turing Pharmaceuticals, testifies at second hearing conducted by Senate's Special Committee on Aging to investigate firms that acquire established drugs and inflate their prices; said he was fired weeks after he voiced objections to chief executive Martin Shkreli regarding company's plan to raise price of Daraprim, drug used to treat parasitic infections, from $13.50 to $750 per pill.
lead_paragraph: The lawyer, Howard Dorfman, told a Senate panel that he told Martin Shkreli that the move would negatively affect Turing’s business and reputation.

headline.main: Lawyer for Turing Said He Warned Against Drug Price Increase
headline.print_headline: Turing Lawyer Warned Against Price Increase on Drug
